stain.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to accidentally make a mark on something, especially one that cannot be removed, or to be marked in this way
stain.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Be careful you don’t stain the carpet.
Her fingers were stained yellow from years of smoking.
a cowboy hat stained with dust and sweat
stain.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
stain.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
stain.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink
stain.translation[1].definitions[0].note: stubborn stains (=ones that are very difficult to remove)
stain.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: White vinegar is great for removing stains.
How do you get wine stains out of a tablecloth?
There was a dark red stain on the carpet.
stain.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a special liquid that you use to change the colour of something, especially wood
stain.translation[1].note_box[0].section: How can I get coffee stains out of a cotton tablecloth?
There was a brown stain on the bedroom ceiling.
Lighter fuel can be used to remove more stubborn stains.
He was trying to remove a stain from his jacket.
Fruit juice stains can be hard to shift.
You’ll never get that stain out.
She didn’t want to get a stain on her new dress.
She wiped the soup off her blouse, but it left a stain.
A dark stain spread over the grey carpet.
Here are a few quick tips for stain removal.
